Michigan Initial Health & Safety Training Module B   
Section 2: Administration of Medication

Medication Procedure

There is a proper procedure to use when administering medications to children under your care. The steps to take involve the following: 

1

Wash Hands

Wash your hands before preparing the medication.

2

The Five Rights

Verify the right child, right medication, right dose, right way, and right time using the Five Rights. 

3

Prepare Medication

Prepare the meds on a clean surface away from diapering and toileting areas.

4

Liquid Medications

For liquid meds use a clean medicine cup, syringe, dropper, or medicine spoon with measurements on it. Do not use table service spoons. 

5

Capsules or Pills

For capsules or pills, dispense as directed by the health care provider. 

6

Wash Hands (Again)

Wash your hands after administering the medication. 

7

Record

Record on the child’s record (administration log). 

8

Observe

Observe the child for side effects, document on the child’s authorization form, if severe seek out emergency care. Always notify parents.
